intro: Hieracium penduliforme var. microphoron, commonly known as the small-flowered hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with erect, hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, with small, rounded ray florets and numerous tubular disk florets, blooming from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in moist meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, often forming dense colonies.
